headline: Excellent Company with Abundant Deal Exposure
pros:
1. Fast-paced Environment with mentors and colleagues willing to teach and a very steep learning curve
2. Gain on-hand experience with 20-30 deals in three months
3. Rotate between different industry teams to obtain comprehensive learning of the financial industry
4. Intern can participate in the deal pitching process, or even meet and consult with industry famous fund managers
5. Tasks are very flexible, interesting, and challenging
6. Good location with good restaurant and convenient transportation at Beijing
7. Employees are very intelligent and open-minded
cons:
1. Some tasks like book-building, office memos can be tedious and time-consuming
2. Mentors are very busy and only give limited feedbacks
3. Tough hours and no weekend
4. Salary is not as high as Bulge Bracket banks in HongKong
5. As a China State-Owned Enterprise, sometimes the culture can be introvert and need to work on maintaining a good "relationship" with senior management

cons: The atmosphere is not so international. The hours are sometimes bed and employees often work late.

headline: junior sales trader
pros: Good place for being a senior there.
cons: not enough mentorship for young guys, neither mobility.

headline: Great place to work
pros: One could learn very soon through a lot of deals in a very short time period.
cons: Salary is as good as you imagine for college graduates seeking Investment Banking.

headline: Summer Intern
pros: A lot new things to learn. Will assign you actual work to do.
cons: No such teamwork environment, employees just work on their own stuff

headline: Great experience
pros: Nice people, adaptable working environment, and a lot to learn every day.
cons: Working hour is quite long, and the peer pressure is large.

headline: Analyst
pros: They offer very good training. the exit option is usually the best among the industry.
cons: sometimes working hour is crazy. but it's common for top investment banking

headline: Associate
pros:
Best IB in China
Good Deal flow
Excellent track record
cons: Generally good. Not anything specifics

headline: Intern (M&A)
pros: hours are pretty good comparing to multinational banks
cons: relatively less international deals to be honest

headline: CICC intern
pros: great chance to learn more about the Chinese security market
cons: might be a little to busy

headline: Associate
pros: great culture, smart people and nice people. Professional in work and high standard for risk management.
cons: structure loose for some department, SOE

headline: Associate
pros: not recommended for short term opportunity but good for long term. it takes some time for new joiners to see the value
cons: not recommended for same reason as above but good for long term. it takes some time for new joiners to see the value

headline: Good company with a focus on China
pros: Very Chinese dominated bank, serving Chinese clients. Specialize in A-share and H-share products. Competitive pay in mainland China.
cons: Deal flow may vary from different teams, IBD oriented investment bank.

headline: Top-class Chinese Investment Bank
pros: Nice Culture. Colleges Extremely helpful and good work life balance. Have a lot of SOE deals and top prestige in China.
cons: Outlook has not been good in the past decades and not too many deals from the private sector. Don't meet senior level bankers often.

headline: Wealth Managemnt
pros: good environment, friendly, free food, learns enough knowledge, good location, during weekends get time to rest and travel and no need to work not much extra hours
cons: job repetitive and sometimes boring, hard to go up the rank, need to wait a long time, so improvement is slow

headline: A very good place to start
pros: It is really a very good place to start your career in mainland China. Though business might not be strong, the most brilliant people are here.
cons: Relatively stressful lifestyle, you're under much pressure even you're a junior people in the firm

headline: Great culture
pros:
Culture is great
Localization is good
cons: I think the IPO is not necessarily a good action for the company.

headline: IBD intern
pros: with a lot of talented colleagues
cons: but the hours were rather long. But if you are okay with IBD lifestyle. It's a good place

headline: above average broker
pros: good lifestyle, easy going senior people, strong network with SOE, and growing relationship with SME, it is still one of the top broker in china
cons: no very competitive salary, organization is huge and somewhat lack of efficiency sometimes. not stable and always changing management committee

headline: trader
pros: great place to word, relative high pay
cons: high pressure and it's hard to get promotion without background

headline: good office environment
pros: Good for Chinese to involve deeply. The good location and office facility. The colleagues are friendly and nice to each other.
cons: CICC US doesn't have a strong IBD department. And the whole volume of transactions are relatively small. And the diversity of employees needs some improvement.

headline: Dead end office
pros: Working hours are easy and office is in a good location.
cons: No future prospects, dead end job, management is terrible, culture is bad, pay is below bottom of market.

headline: Great Experience
pros: Great training and excellent platform
cons: Too competitive and long hours of working

headline: Derivative Accountant
pros: Gain Derivative knowledge from different areas
cons: lack of assistant and not headquarter for HK

headline: Great working place, a lot of deals and IPOs, best exposure to China.
pros: Great working place, a lot of deals and IPOs, best exposure to China.
cons: No much cons that I can think of except a long working hours as in all BB banks.

headline: Worked in CICC
pros: Technical training is good, the background of staff is good, deal flow in China is good, strong in IPO in mainland china, leading in Chinese investment banks and reputation is good, dealflow is good and the pipeline is strong enough
cons: High turnover rate, not that stable career development, working atmosphere could be improved, company transformation is occuring, pay for entry level analyst could be improved

headline: Full of office politics
pros:
Flexible sick leave. They have an attendance system, but people rules here, if you know what I mean.
Exposure to updated rumors on China business and politics.
cons:
Poor management, sort of appreciate-the-job-or-get-off.
Too much office politics. You can hardly imagine how complexed the relationship is in such a small office.
Stagnancy in every business.
Lot of restrictions from its Beijing headquarter.

headline: international atomosphere. good experience
pros:
-good team
-international culture compared to other local firms
cons: -co-workers turn over is fast.

headline: Good working environment, great colleague
pros:
Great platform for us to learn
Superior working environment with extremely nice co-workers
cons:
The compensation is way lower than international pay level
Also there're some vips who are hard to come by

headline: Associate
pros: Salary,people, work, prospect, learning, training
cons: Working hours, hours, long hours

headline: Associate
pros:
good entry-level training
steep learning curve at the beginning
dinner reimbursement
cons:
Not very good compensation
Bad IT service
Not much exposure for entry-level positions

headline: Good platform with excellent client base and fairly good deal experience
pros: Good platform with excellent client base and fairly good deal experience, Lean structure and very hands-on MDs and EDs with insightful view to share with you, office culture is fine for a Chinese IB
cons: Lack of top-notch training program, Less transparency in annual review, Less and less unclear company vision and set of values

headline: Great place to learn fundamental financial knowledge and develop interpersonal skills.
pros: Career development, company culture is friendly, annual leave days are long
cons: life-work balance, high working pressure environment

headline: A place to go if you have no other options.
pros: Most people working at middle and back office are friendly and willing to show you the lay of the land. A couple people at front office are okay as well but certainly not all of them.
cons: Some people in the front office clearly think they are smarter than you just because they got a break earlier than you or just got lucky at one point or another. Management and HR are especially full of themselves. It's a cash-strapped company with no growth for most employees.

headline: Summer Analyst
pros: The culture is very good..
cons: Pay , you know how it is

headline: Terrific
pros: CICC is basically the best investment bank in China. What impresses me most is that your co-workers at CICC could be very intelligent and friendly. Some of my former co-workers make my best partners in career. CICC has a very professional approach of doing business beyond many of its peers. Its culture for a high level of excellence makes difference in its employees.
cons: As a banker at CICC, you get to touch most big deals in China. In return, one's personal life must be balanced. For young bankers looking at MBA applications, this might be one of the best places to work at in China.

headline: Eye opening
pros: Not bad if you don't have access to Facebook from your mobile phone.
cons:
If you want IT support? Hire an IT savvy person in your own department.
Everything is paper based; get used to it. 
People with different views are suppressed with creative tactics (ambush marathon meetings, calls from the top, cold shoulder treatment etc.). Original in its own way.

headline: Pretty good work experience
pros: If you go bilingual with Chinese and English or want to focus on Asian market, it is a great place. Nice work-life balance for an investment bank.
cons: Potential still needs to be proved, hope to see more opportunities with China getting more involved in investing globally.

headline: learn a lot from this job
pros: Feel comfortable in this position , know a lot of customers, learn a lot of customer service skills from this position, as a freshman in career, CICC give me a good lesson.
cons: low salary, some times too much overtime,  its a big challenge for me sometimes

headline: good
pros: biggest ib in china, better place than other us based bb
cons: almost no. highly recommend. good luck.

headline: Research Assistant
pros: It‘s an investment bank owned by Chinese government. You can imagine all connections the company has. It dominates the business in Mainland China. As the research team is short of people, you will be given great responsibilities.
cons: Awkward working environment, company is currently cutting budget by lowering salaries for more than three times within a year. Poor structure for research team. Too many stupid and ridiculous rules about format. You will spend a large portion of your energy and time on uploading the reports rather than writting it.

headline: Managements don't care about the employees AT ALL!
pros: New York was my dream city, but CICC made it bad. Only first and last day were happy days.
cons: I'll never go back. Managements don't care about the employees at all at all at all! Pay is not good for most employees. I have a schoolmate and is a client, he said "your management just doesn't get it".

headline: Summer IT internship in CICC
pros: Stimulating work environment , Professional team , nice office
cons: Working overtime on a regular basis

headline: Good investment banking exposure but be aware of complicated company politics
pros: Relatively well balanced work life compared to other investment banks.
cons: Be aware of complicated company politics. No proper incentives for better performers. Company development strategy not clear. Talents cannot be retained. Unstable job security.

headline: Investment banking
pros: Good Platform, opportunities to learn
cons: Bad Management, dishearting company culture

headline: Typical Chinese firm
pros: Good place to build up your knowledge of China
cons: pyramid organization structure induces low efficiency

headline: Associate
pros: Good exposure, steep learning curve, new challenges all the time.
cons: It really depends which team you are in. If you follow a great boss, you will benefit from the work. But if you are not lucky to follow a good boss, then things may be unsatisfied.

headline: VP, equity research
pros: top brand in China equity coverage
cons: less merit based bonus compensation

headline: china leading investment bank now facing big challenges
pros:
good payment in china
good reputation in industry
cons: industry downside affected its performance

headline: Very good Chinese investment bank
pros: insight on China equity and fixed income
cons: cyclical nature of Chinese economy lead to cyclical compensation

headline: Professional and intellectual working environmet
pros: Smart people and very professional
cons: very local and chinese style

headline: nice working environment, but still a little Chinese style
pros: China's top one in investment banking industry
cons: business not every good in recent years

headline: Good company generally
pros: Relatively good pay, collabrative culture
cons: long working hours, high pressure

headline: Weak corporate culture
pros: good research with knowledgeable analysts
cons: mgt don't know what they are talking about, lack of experience

headline: Challenging
pros: great environment, lots of great colleagues
cons: often have to works over time

headline: Young Company, still have a lot of room togrowth, need solid mgt skill
pros: Gain direct access to Mainland China
cons: mgt tend to be short sited, strategic plan changes a lot

headline: assistant
pros: Experience for the financial market industry and desktop rearch ability
cons: High workloard, very limited training and undesirable atmosphere
